data.title: Lincoln Center
data.meta_description: The world's leading performing arts center. The best in music, dance, opera, theater, cinema, and more.
data.text:
Pick Up/Drop Off: Broadway at West 60th Street

Access-A-Ride Drop Off: 10 Columbus Circle

Accessible Entry: All three Jazz at Lincoln Center venues are accessible through primary entrance on Broadway at West 60th Street; box office for Rose Theater and The Appel Room is on the ground floor; elevators go to the fifth and sixth floors where all three theaters are located.

Accessible Seating: Available throughout the theaters. People who use wheelchairs and are able to transfer may request an aisle seat with removable armrest. Specify wheelchair accessible seating requests when purchasing tickets.

Wheelchair Loans available for people who require a wheelchair to go to and from their seats. Please call the House Manager at 212-258-9501 on the day before the concert to arrange this service.

Restrooms: Accessible gendered restrooms on the orchestra and mezzanine levels.

Water Fountains: Accessible on the orchestra and mezzanine levels.

Braille & Large Print Programs: Available for all Jazz at Lincoln Center and Lincoln Center Presents concerts in the Rose Theater and The Appel Room. The programs may be obtained at an Information Table on the fifth floor.
